intro: Oreocomopsis stelliphora, commonly known as the star-flowered oreocomopsis, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a star-like pattern, giving it its common name. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Oreocomopsis stelliphora is a perennial herb that is often found in the Andes mountains.
